data.title: PCRBPL Book Picks
data.text:
Welcome to PCRBPL Book Picks!

By Patty Monaghan

Welcome to PCRBPL Book Picks, the official blog of the Port Chester-Rye Brook Public Library! Have you ever had trouble finding the perfect book to read? Do you want to explore genres that are new to you? Are you looking to discover a new favorite author? We’ve got the book picks for you!

We strive to recommend intriguing books that will fulfill the wants, needs, and interests of our patrons. If you’re looking for more recommendations or need help navigating the catalog or our digital resources, please contact the library at 914-939-6710. Our team of outstanding reference librarians will be happy to assist you. Happy reading!

Read This Summer!

By Patty Monaghan

Whether you’re basking at the beach or sitting in front of your air conditioner, there is no better time to read than during the sweltering heat of summer. Using your library card, you can access a wealth of fantastic books, ebooks, and audiobooks to keep you entertained all summer long.

Check out the links below! Additionally, don’t forget to visit the Information Desk to sign up for our Adult & Teen Summer Reading Bingo program.

Place holds on physical items using the Westchester Library System’s catalog:

● New York Times Bestselling Fiction

● New York Times Bestselling Nonfiction

● Biographies & Memoirs

● Contemporary Fiction

● Historical Fiction

● Mysteries

● Nonfiction: Music History

● True Crime Nonfiction

Discover excellent ebooks and audiobooks on OverDrive/Libby:

● Thrillers, Scares, and Suspense

● From Page to Screen

● Armchair Travel

Hop on to hoopla for a terrific selection of ebooks and audiobooks:

● Ebooks by Celebrity Authors

● Ebooks: Oprah’s Book Club Picks

● Ebooks: Read with Jenna’s Book Club Picks

● Ebooks: Reese’s Book Club Picks

● Audiobooks: 2024 Audie Award Winners

● Audiobooks: Criminally Good Listens

● Audiobooks: Celebrity Memoirs

● Audiobooks: Fiction & Biographies Narrated by Celebrities

If you need help navigating any of the aforementioned resources, please contact the library at 914-939-6710. One of our reference librarians will be happy to assist you!

Celebrate LGBTQ+ Pride This June!

By Patty Monaghan

June is LGBTQ+ Pride Month! Honor and celebrate the achievements and experiences of the LGBTQ+ community by exploring the vast offerings of our catalog and digital resources. The links below will lead you to a plethora of timely books and films that you can access for free with your library card.

Place holds on physical items using the Westchester Library System’s catalog:

LGBTQ+ Fiction Books

LGBTQ+ Nonfiction & Biographies

LGBTQ+ Movies on DVD

Use OverDrive/Libby to discover ebooks and audiobooks:

LGBTQ+ Fiction

LGBTQ+ Nonfiction & Biographies

Head over to hoopla for a wide range of ebooks, audiobooks, and movies:

Ebooks: LGBTQ+ Stories & Experiences

Audiobooks: LGBTQ+ Voices & Experiences

LGBTQIA+ Movies

Log in to Kanopy to access their LGBTQ+ Cinema collection, which includes an eclectic selection of Academy Award-winning films as well as independent films, cult classics, documentaries, world cinema, and biopics.

If you need help navigating any of the aforementioned resources, please contact the library at 914-939-6710. One of our reference librarians will be happy to assist you!

Happy St. Patrick’s Day!

By Patty Monaghan

Bring out your lucky charms, for St. Patrick’s Day is on its way! If pubs, parties, and parades aren’t your thing, get your green on by picking up any of the three cozy Irish books below. Double your luck by pairing your read with a film from Kanopy’s Irish Cinema collection!

Irish Coffee Murder by Leslie Meier

New York Times bestselling author Leslie Meier returns with another holiday-themed cozy mystery featuring part-time reporter and amateur sleuth Lucy Stone. While covering a story on four Irish step dancing students, one of the dancer’s mothers is found dead. Did a stage mom take rivalry too far, or is another motive at play? Also included in this volume are two more stellar murder mysteries centered around St. Patrick’s Day: Death of an Irish Coffee Drinker by Lee Hollis and Perked Up by Barbara Ross.

Sheltering Rain by Jojo Moyes

Beloved author Jojo Moyes made her debut as a novelist in 2002 with this remarkable story of the unbreakable bond between mothers and daughters. Estranged from her mother since she ran

away from her rural Irish home, Kate vowed that she would always be there for her daughter, Sabine. However, when Sabine decides to travel to Ireland to find her grandmother, Kate is forced to face the consequences of her actions and realizes that it may be time to finally heal old wounds. Prepare to be swept away by Moyes’ engaging characters and atmospheric settings.

Murder in an Irish Bookshop by Carlene O’Connor

Old-world Irish charm abounds in this cozy mystery set in the County Cork village of Kilbane. When an event at the new village bookstore results in the murder of one of the featured authors, it’s up to amateur sleuth Siobhan O’Sullivan to find out which literary guest closed the book on someone’s life. Fans of Maeve Binchy’s enchanting writing, Janet Evanovich’s wit, and M.C. Beaton’s page-turning suspense will fall head over heels for O’Connor’s delightful storytelling.

Discover Books & Films for Black History Month

By Patty Monaghan

Black History Month is a time to honor the trials, tribulations, and triumphs of one of the world’s most radiant cultures. Countless writers, actors, and artists of color have utilized remarkable creative expression and vast knowledge to make impressive and long-lasting contributions to mass media.

Expand your knowledge of African American history by checking out this list of nonfiction books that are available at our library. Place your holds now!

Do you enjoy using OverDrive/Libby? Click the following links to access a wealth of ebooks and audiobooks right at your fingertips:

African American Fiction Ebooks

African American Fiction Audiobooks

African American Nonfiction Ebooks

African American Nonfiction Audiobooks

If you’re a hoopla user, explore their vast ebook collection, Black Stories & Experiences, as well as their impressive Celebrating Black Talent film collection.

Looking for more examples of African American cinema? Delve into the rich tapestry of Black history with Kanopy’s Black History Month collection of movies and documentaries.

Beach Reads!

By Patty Monaghan

Summer is here, which means it’s time for beach read recommendations! Whether you’re basking in the summer sun or pulling up a seat in front of the air conditioner, we guarantee that these terrific books will keep you hooked for hours on end. Pour a glass of your favorite iced beverage, and get ready to read!

Don’t want to lug around a physical book on your summer vacation? Check out hoopla’s Summer Road Trip and Summer Sci Fi e-book collections! Additionally, cool down by binge-watching your way through Kanopy’s Summer Reading from Book to Screen catalog.

Celebrate National Library Week!

By Patty Monaghan

For 65 years, the American Library Association has observed National Library Week during the month of April. This year, National Library Week will be celebrated from April 23rd through April 29th. During this time, libraries and librarians around the country are honored for their contributions to the communities they so proudly serve.

If you would like to extend your gratitude to our library in honor of National Library Week, please consider purchasing items from our Amazon Wishlist, or make a donation to the Friends of the Library. We greatly appreciate your generosity!

Soak up all the library love this month by checking out these four superb library-centric works of fiction.

New Year’s Reading Resolutions

By Patty Monaghan

The start of a new year brings all of us fresh opportunities to improve our lives. While New Year’s resolutions typically pertain to physical and mental health, we can also resolve to enhance our reading lives. If you are looking to expand your literary horizons in 2023, we encourage you to start right here. Happy reading!

Want to join a Book Club this year? Information Services Librarian Stacey Harris leads a monthly book club discussion for adults, both in person at the library and via Zoom. More information can be found here.

If you’d like to devote more time to reading ebooks and audiobooks, check out OverDrive, Libby, hoopla, and Freading. These free digital services give you access to thousands of materials that you can explore with your library card. If you need help navigating any of these services, contact the library and we’ll be happy to assist you. Here are some great books to help you widen your reading life in 2023!

September 21st is National New York Day!

By Patty Monaghan

Start spreading the news…National New York Day is this month! Expand your knowledge of the land we call home by checking out any of these incredibly interesting books about our great state.

Interested in visiting New York State’s exquisite parks, lakes, and beaches? Borrow our Empire Pass! The Empire Pass can be borrowed for seven days and can be reserved up to one month in advance. The pass allows free admission for one vehicle to access numerous outdoor areas throughout New York State, including Jones Beach, Bear Mountain, and Niagara Falls. Full guidelines and a complete list of where to visit can be found here.

We are also excited to offer complimentary passes to the Franklin D. Roosevelt Presidential Library and Museum located in Hyde Park, New York! Each pass entitles one family (defined as a group of up to five individuals) free admission to the FDR Presidential Library and Museum. Please note that this pass does not include access to the President’s Home or any other Roosevelt sites. More information can be found here.

Women’s History Month: Nora Roberts

By: Patty Monaghan

You would be hard pressed to find someone who has never heard of Nora Roberts. Since 1991, she has penned more than 215 New York Times bestsellers, nearly 50 of which lay under her pseudonym, J.D. Robb. According to Roberts’ official website, 27 of her books are sold every minute.

If you feel a tad intimidated by her massive catalog, you are not alone! From contemporary romance and mysteries to paranormal intrigue, there’s a Nora Roberts book that you are bound to love. We’ve compiled some of the best places to start right here:
